free.jin
Interface JinConnection

All Known Subinterfaces:
FriendsJinConnection, GameListJinConnection, PGNJinConnection, SeekJinConnection
public interface JinConnection

Defines the interface between the chess server and the client. Some restrictions/rules on the implementation that can't be enforced by the compiler:

  • The implementation is responsible for firing events to registered listeners when needed. However, if a certain feature which is implied by calling the listener is not supported by the server, the implementation may ignore addListener and removeListener calls related to that feature or not fire events of that type.
  • The calls to all the listeners must be done in the AWT event dispatching thread.
  • The implementation is supposed to be completely self sufficient, meaning that only the methods specified in the interface are required to normally interact with it. For example, you can't require to call a special method to enable a certain feature - the implementation must decide by itself when to enable and when to disable the feature.
  • The implementation must supress the textual message accompanying some event (sent by the server) when at least a single listener of that event is registered. On the other hand, the same textual message must NOT be supressed when there are no listeners registered.
  • The implementation must be consistent in calling listeners. For example if a certain order of events is implied, the listeners must be called in that order - a MoveEvent must not be fired before a GameStartedEvent has been fired for that game or after a GameEndedEvent has been fired.
  • If the server supports a certain feature only partially, the implementation is responsible for implementing the rest itself where possible and for providing default or blank values where impossible.
Some assumptions the implementation is allowed to make:
  • Although it is not guaranteed that all calls to the Connection's methods will be done in any particular thread (including the AWT Event dispatching thread), the implementation may assume that all calls from user code will be sequential, i.e. no calls to any methods will be done by the user code while one of the methods is executing from a thread other than the one executing that method.
The restrictions above are to be treated as assumptions for user code and the assumptions above are to be treated as restrictions for user code.

If the server supports additional features beyond the specified in the interface, it may add methods supporting these features. The server specific user code, may then cast the implementation to its actual type and use these methods. If certain features are supported in an extended form (more information is sent by the server than is needed to support the interface), the implementation may (but doesn't have to) fire subclasses of the appropriate events (or return subclasses of objects in case of queries), adding the information sent by the server. The server specific user code handling the event (or issuing the query), in turn, may (but again, does not have to) cast the event (or returned object) to its actual type and retrieve the extra information.

Method Detail

getJinListenerManager

free.jin.event.JinListenerManager getJinListenerManager()
Returns the JinListenerManager for this JinConnection. Via this object, you can register and unregister listeners for various events.

connectAndLogin

boolean connectAndLogin()
                        throws java.io.IOException
Connects and logs in to the server. Throws an IOException if couldn't connect successfully. Returns true if successfully logged in, false otherwise.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

getLoginErrorMessage

java.lang.String getLoginErrorMessage()
Returns a message describing the error that occurred during the login procedure, if any.

isConnected

boolean isConnected()
Returns true if this Connection is currently connected to the server, returns false otherwise.

disconnect

void disconnect()
                throws java.io.IOException
Disconnects from the server.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

getUsername

java.lang.String getUsername()
Returns the username of the account. This method should only be called after connect() returns.

getHostname

java.lang.String getHostname()
Returns the hostname of the server this Connection is connecting to.

getPort

int getPort()
Returns the port this Connection is connecting on.

sendCommand

void sendCommand(java.lang.String command)
Sends an arbitrary string to the server. Use this only for server specific commands or commands issued manually by the user. Using this method for sending other commands makes your client incompatible with other servers besides the one you are using.

exit

void exit()
Sends the command closing the session to the server - this is usually "quit", or "exit".

quitGame

void quitGame(Game game)
Quits the given game. Whatever relation I had to this game is closed, this may mean, unobserving, resigning, unexamining or any other operation that closes the game. The passed Game object must be the one created by the implementation of this class, and not just one you created yourself.

makeMove

void makeMove(Game game,
              Move move)
Makes the given move in the given Game. The specified Game must be an instance created by this JinConnection.

resign

void resign(Game game)
Resigns the given game. The given game must be a played game and of type Game.MY_GAME.

requestDraw

void requestDraw(Game game)
Sends a request to draw the given game. The given game must be a played game and of type Game.MY_GAME.

isAbortSupported

boolean isAbortSupported()
Returns true if the server supports aborting a game. If the implementation returns true in this method, it also must implement the requestAbort(Game) method.

requestAbort

void requestAbort(Game game)
Sends a request to abort the given game. The given game must be a played game and of type Game.MY_GAME.

isAdjournSupported

boolean isAdjournSupported()
Returns true if the server supports adjourning a game. If the implementation returns true in this method, it also must implement the requestAdjourn(Game) method.

requestAdjourn

void requestAdjourn(Game game)
Sends a request to adjourn the given game. The given game must be a played game and of type Game.MY_GAME.

goBackward

void goBackward(Game game,
                int plyCount)
Goes back the given amount of plies in the given game. If the given amount of plies is bigger than the amount of plies since the beginning of the game, goes to the beginning of the game.

goForward

void goForward(Game game,
               int plyCount)
Goes forward the given amount of plies in the given game. If the given amount of plies is bigger than the amount of plies remaining until the end of the game, goes to the end of the game.

goToBeginning

void goToBeginning(Game game)
Goes to the beginning of the given game.

goToEnd

void goToEnd(Game game)
Goes to the end of the given game.
